intro: Manihot boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a fibrous root system. It is often cultivated for its starchy roots, which are used in cooking. Its growth habits make it adaptable to various soil types and climates.
